export
Class ExportGraphic

java.lang.Object
  export.ExportGraphic

public class ExportGraphic
extends java.lang.Object

ExportGraphic.java v.1.4 Handle graphic export of a Fidocad file This class should be used to export the circuit under different graphic formats. 


   Version History 

Version   Date           Author       Remarks
------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1.0     December 2007   D. Bucci    First working version: format PNG
1.1     January 2008    D. Bucci        Internazionalized version
1.2             June 2008               D. Bucci        A few improvements
1.3     July 2008           D. Bucci    A few more graphic formats
1.4             January 2009    D. Bucci    Bug fixes

Method Detail

export

public static void export(java.io.File file,
                          ParseSchem P,
                          java.lang.String format,
                          double unitperpixel,
                          boolean antiAlias,
                          boolean blackWhite,
                          boolean ext)
                   throws java.io.IOException
Exports the circuit contained in circ using the specified parsing class.

Parameters:
file - the file name of the graphic file which will be created.
P - the parsing schematics class which should be used (libraries).
circ - the StringBuffer containing the circuit to be traced.
format - the graphic format which should be used {png|jpg}.
unitperpixel - the number of unit for each graphic pixel.
antiAlias - specify whether the anti alias option should be on.
blackWhite - specify that the export should be done in B/W.
ext - activate FidoCadJ extensions when exporting
Throws:
java.io.IOException

getImageSize

public static java.awt.Dimension getImageSize(ParseSchem P,
                                              double unitperpixel,
                                              boolean countMin)
Get the image size.

Parameters:
P - the parsing class to be used.
unitperpixel - the zoom set to be used.
countMin - specifies that the size should be calculated counting the minimum x and y coordinates, and not the origin.

getImageOrigin

public static java.awt.Point getImageOrigin(ParseSchem P,
                                            double unitperpixel)
Get the image origin.

Parameters:
P - the parsing class to be used.
unitperpixel - the zoom set to be used.

calculateZoomToFit

public static MapCoordinates calculateZoomToFit(ParseSchem P,
                                                int sizex,
                                                int sizey,
                                                boolean forceCalc,
                                                boolean countMin)
Calculate the zoom to fit the given size in pixel (i.e. the viewport size).

Parameters:
sizex - the width of the area to be used for calculations.
sizey - the height of the area to be used for calculations.
countMin - specify if the absolute or relative size should be taken into account
